title: Christine McGuinness rocks see-through dress on Manchester night out
text:
Christina dared to bare in the stunning gown (Picture: Aaron Parfitt/SplashNews.com)

Christine McGuiness was owning the style game as she sported a stunning see-through dress at Manchester Fashion Festival on Saturday night.

The Real Housewives Of Cheshire star showed off her amazing figure in the heavily beaded dress, with the sleeveless design highlighting her toned arms at the style celebration at the city’s Hilton Hotel.

With the dress’ intricately embroidered panels covering her modesty, Christine went jewellery free and let her gown do the talking while carrying a silver Yves Saint Laurent bag.

Only wearing a matching navy thong, all eyes were on 31-year-old Christine, who was joined by her fellow northerners, model Rhian Sugden and Kym Marsh.

Documenting her night out over on her Instagram Stories (stars: they’re just like us!), Christine had a fab evening, letting loose on the dance floor while grooving to Proud Mary by Tina Turner.

The mother-of-three, who is married to TV presenter and comedian Paddy McGuinness, is never one to shy away from an OTT outfit, recently sporting a pink PVC look as Bondage Barbie for a fancy dress party.

If you’ve got it, flaunt it (Picture: Aaron Parfitt/SplashNews.com)

If we looked like Christine, we’d never wear clothes again (Picture: Aaron Parfitt/SplashNews.com)

The cheek of some people (Picture: Aaron Parfitt/SplashNews.com)

You know, subtle stuff.

Over the years, the model has struggled with her body image and has spoken openly about the toll eating disorders had on her mental and physical health.

‘I had anorexia for over 10 years as a child, all through my teenage years, [and was getting better] when I met my husband aged 19, 20,’ she told Giovanna Fletcher’s Happy Mum Happy Baby Live podcast.

‘It was that strive and I just really wanted to be a mum that made me get over that,’ she continued.

‘When I went to see a doctor the reason I wasn’t ovulating or having my periods was down to having an eating disorder. That made me get better but it took four years for everything to regulate.’
